episodes.title: Inside the Epstein Investigation With the Reporter Who Uncovered It
episodes.description:
“I know a lot of stuff, but I can't report it because the victims don't want to go public, and they're afraid. And, you know, I can't go out there and say this happened without having some proof… I just keep digging and hopefully I'll get to the truth, you know? But, this whole climate in the media is very disheartening.”

In this Substack Live, John Harwood speaks with journalist Julie K. Brown, whose investigations into Jeffrey Epstein led to his arrest in 2019. They discuss Trump’s relationship with Epstein, the files and if the Trump administration can continue to ignore calls for the full release.

The investigative reporter who broke the Epstein story in November 2018 says she believes she still hasn’t learned the full scope of crimes in this scandal involving wealthy and powerful people and the young girls who were victimized.

This Substack Live discussion published last week on zeteo.com. If you want early, exclusive access to this kind of independent, unfiltered journalism — subscribe to our Substack here: https://zeteo.com/subscribe

If you want to increase your financial support for our work and help us grow, donate to Zeteo! https://zeteo.com/p/donate-to-zeteo

CHAPTERS
00:00 Intro
03:07 Reporting on Jeffrey Epstein
07:08 Growing Epstein scandal
12:54 Trump and Epstein’s relationship
17:11 Why didn’t the Biden administration go after Trump?
22:36 Are Epstein victims conversations credible?
24:50 Epstein’s network
30:45 Epstein’s death
37:27 Republican Party
40:15 Media under Trump’s second term
